title: Généralités
text:
Investigateur principal : Mme Sandrine GUENEAU






Avertissement



“Appeler un statisticien après que l’expérience est terminée, c’est comme lui demander de faire une autopsie ; il pourra seulement déterminer la cause de l’échec de l’expérience.”
Sir Ronald A. Fisher, FRS




Code
rm(list = ls())
#
library(corrplot)
library(readODS)
library(baseph)
# library(GGally)
library(ggsci)
# library(ggstats)
library(tidyverse)
library(missMDA)
library(FactoMineR)
library(factoextra)
library(nnet)
library(kableExtra)
library(gtsummary)
# library(DataExplorer)
# library(colorspace)
# library(forestmodel)
library(janitor)
# library(fmsb)
library(labelled)
#
classeur <- "htahad.ods"
expx <- FALSE
if (expx) {
  file.create(classeur)
  file.remove(classeur)
  write_ods(iris, classeur)
}

# sessionInfo()
theme_gtsummary_language(language = "fr", decimal.mark = ",")
# theme_gtsummary_journal(journal = "jama")
options(OutDec = ",")
ptest <- list(all_continuous() ~ "wilcox.test", all_categorical() ~ "chisq.test")


::: {.panel-tabset}

Généralités


Code
tt <- read_ods("datas/htahad.ods", sheet = "tableau", na = c("", "NC", "NA")) |>
  clean_names() |>
  ## Recodage de tt$mater_origine
  mutate(mater_origine = fct_recode(mater_origine,
    "Argenteuil" = "argenteuil",
    "Delafontaine" = "DELAFONTAINE",
    "Montfermeil" = "MONTFERMEIL",
    "Pontoise" = "pontoise"
  )) |>
  mutate(gem = fct_recode(gem,
    "Gémellaire" = "BIBI",
    "Gémellaire" = "GEM",
    "Non gémellaire" = "non"
  )) |>
  mutate(across(where(is.character), ~ as.factor(.x))) |>
  mutate(across(starts_with("nb_"), ~ as.factor(.x))) |>
  mutate(ipp = as.factor(ipp)) |>
  mutate(across(starts_with("prot_"), ~ fct_relevel(
    .x,
    "neg", "0,3-1", "1 a 3", ">3"
  ))) |>
  ## Réordonnancement de tt$terme_mise_en_place_ttt
  mutate(across(starts_with("traitement"), ~ fct_relevel(
    .x,
    "aucun", "monothérapie", "Bithérapie", "trithérapie"
  ))) |>
  mutate(imc = factor(bmiph(imc))) |>
  ## Recodage de tt$imc
  mutate(imc = fct_recode(imc,
    "maigreur - normal" = "maigreur",
    "maigreur - normal" = "normal"
  )) |>
  ## Réordonnancement de tt$nb_bvr
  mutate(nb_bvr = fct_relevel(
    nb_bvr,
    "1", "2", "1/mois", "2/mois", "1/sem", "2/sem"
  )) |> 
  ## Réordonnancement de tt$issue
mutate(issue = fct_relevel(issue,
    "W spont", "declt prog", "urgences"
  ))
#
bn <- read_ods("datas/htahad.ods", sheet = "bnom")
bn <- bn$nom
var_label(tt) <- bn
save(tt, file = "datas/htahad.RData")


L’échantillon conservé pour l’analyse statistique comporte 112 patients pour 32 variables.


Population


Code
tt |>
  select(mater_origine:patho_associe) |>
  tbl_summary(missing = "no") |>
  add_n() |>
  bold_labels() |>
  modify_header(label ~ " ") |>
  pexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "popu", lg = TRUE)

title: Généralités
text:
Analyse en régression
On défini la modalité W spontanée comme référence : les comparaisons sont à comprendre la modalité indiquée vs W spontanée.


Code
multinom(
  issue ~
    mater_origine +
    age_au_ddg,
  data = tt
) |>
  tbl_regression(exponentiate = TRUE) |> 
    bold_labels() |>
  modify_header(label ~ " ") |>
  hexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "entreeissue")


# weights:  18 (10 variable)
initial  value 123.044576 
iter  10 value 105.022414
final  value 104.847164

title: About
text: Site de travail pour l’étude HTAHAD.

title: Délai hospitalisation - accouchement
text:
Code
rm(list = ls())
#
library(corrplot)
library(readODS)
library(baseph)
# library(GGally)
library(ggsci)
library(plotly)
library(tidyverse)
library(missMDA)
library(FactoMineR)
library(factoextra)
library(nnet)
library(kableExtra)
library(gtsummary)
# library(DataExplorer)
# library(colorspace)
# library(forestmodel)
library(janitor)
# library(fmsb)
library(labelled)
#
classeur <- "htahad.ods"
expx <- FALSE
if (expx) {
  file.create(classeur)
  file.remove(classeur)
  write_ods(iris, classeur)
}

# sessionInfo()
theme_gtsummary_language(language = "fr", decimal.mark = ",")
# theme_gtsummary_journal(journal = "jama")
options(OutDec = ",")
ptest <- list(all_continuous() ~ "wilcox.test", all_categorical() ~ "chisq.test")
load("datas/htahad.RData")



Délai hospitalisation - accouchement


Code
tt |>
  dplyr::select(issue, delai_hospit_acc) |>
  tbl_summary(missing = "no", by = issue) |>
  add_n() |>
  add_p() |>
  bold_labels() |>
  modify_header(label ~ " ") |>
  pexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "delai", lg = TRUE)




Table 1: Délai hospitalisation - accouchement & Urgence
















N
W spont
N = 22
declt prog
N = 51
urgences
N = 39
p-valeur




Délai hospitalisation/acc
110
0,00 (0,00 – 0,00)
1,00 (1,00 – 3,00)
2,00 (0,00 – 7,00)
<0,001



1 Médiane (Q1 – Q3)







2 Test de Kruskal-Wallis



















Code
zz <- tt |>
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = issue, y = delai_hospit_acc, fill = issue) +
  geom_violin() +
  geom_boxplot(width = 0.2, fill = "grey90") +
  # annotate("text", x = 0.6, y = 48, label = "p = 0,3") +
  labs(
    title = "Délai hospitalisation - accouchement & Urgence",
    subtitle = "p <0,001",
    x = "Issue de l'HAD",
    y = "Jours",
    caption = "",
    fill = ""
  ) +
  theme_light() +
  scale_fill_jama() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 12),
    legend.title = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title.y = element_text(
      size = 12,
      angle = 90,
      vjust = .5
    ),
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
    legend.position = "none"
  ) 
  ggplotly(zz)








Figure 1: Délai hospitalisation - accouchement & Urgence






Code
tt |>
  mutate(urg = if_else(issue == "urgences", "Urgences", "non Urgences")) |>
  dplyr::select(urg, delai_hospit_acc) |>
  tbl_summary(missing = "no", by = urg) |>
  add_n() |>
  add_p() |>
  bold_labels() |>
  modify_header(label ~ " ") |>
  pexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "dedelaiurg", lg = TRUE)

title: Issue de l’HAD
text:
Code
rm(list = ls())
#
library(baseph)
# library(GGally)
library(ggsci)
# library(ggstats)
library(tidyverse)
library(nnet)
library(kableExtra)
library(gtsummary)
# library(colorspace)
# library(forestmodel)
library(labelled)
#
classeur <- "htahad.ods"
expx <- FALSE
if (expx) {
  file.create(classeur)
  file.remove(classeur)
  write_ods(iris, classeur)
}

# sessionInfo()
theme_gtsummary_language(language = "fr", decimal.mark = ",")
# theme_gtsummary_journal(journal = "jama")
options(OutDec = ",")
ptest <- list(all_continuous() ~ "wilcox.test", all_categorical() ~ "chisq.test")
load("datas/htahad.RData")
Code
hexptabph <-
  function(dfk,
           exp = FALSE,
           nomfich = "export",
           nomsheet = "x",
           lg = FALSE) {
    zz <- dfk |>
      as_kable_extra() |>
      kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover"),
                    fixed_thead = TRUE) |> 
      scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "780px  ")
    if (exp) {
      dfk |>
        as_tibble() |>
        write_ods(path = nomfich, sheet = nomsheet, append = TRUE)
    }
    return(zz)
  }
On recherche des facteurs éventuels pouvant influencer l’issue de l’HAD.
Code
tt |>
  select(mater_origine:patho_associe, issue) |>
  tbl_summary(
    by = issue,
    missing = "no"
  ) |>
  add_n() |>
  add_p() |>
  bold_labels() |>
  modify_header(label ~ " ") |>
  hexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "popissue", lg = TRUE)

La conclusion de l’HAD semble surtout liée au terrain (atcd, pathologies associées…). Visiblement chaque maternité a sa propre politique de prise en charge des patientes.
Code
tt |>
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = issue, y = age_au_ddg, fill = issue) +
  geom_violin() +
  geom_boxplot(width = 0.2, fill = "grey90") +
  # annotate("text", x = 0.6, y = 48, label = "p = 0,3") +
  labs(
    title = "Issue de l'HAD selon l'âge",
    subtitle = "p = 0,3",
    x = "Issue de l'HAD",
    y = "Âge",
    caption = "",
    fill = ""
  ) +
  theme_light() +
  scale_fill_jama() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 12),
    legend.title = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.title.y = element_text(
      size = 12,
      angle = 90,
      vjust = .5
    ),
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
    legend.position = "none"
  )








Figure 1: Issue de l’HAD selon l’âge

  bold_labels() |>
  modify_header(label ~ " ") |>
  hexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "entreeissue")

title: Issue de l’HAD
text:
Analyse en régression
On défini la modalité W spontanée comme référence : les comparaisons sont à comprendre la modalité indiquée vs W spontanée.


Code
multinom(
  issue ~
    mater_origine +
    age_au_ddg,
  data = tt
) |>
  tbl_regression(exponentiate = TRUE) |> 
    bold_labels() |>
  modify_header(label ~ " ") |>
  hexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "entreeissue")


# weights:  18 (10 variable)

title: Population

Code
rm(list = ls())
#
library(corrplot)
library(readODS)
library(baseph)
# library(GGally)

# library(ggstats)
library(tidyverse)

library(factoextra)

library(kableExtra)
library(gtsummary)
# library(DataExplorer)

# library(forestmodel)
library(janitor)
# library(fmsb)
library(labelled)
#
classeur <- "htahad.ods"
expx <- FALSE
if (expx) {
  file.create(classeur)
  file.remove(classeur)
  write_ods(iris, classeur)
}

# sessionInfo()
theme_gtsummary_language(language = "fr", decimal.mark = ",")
# theme_gtsummary_journal(journal = "jama")
options(OutDec = ",")
ptest <- list(all_continuous() ~ "wilcox.test", all_categorical() ~ "chisq.test")
load("datas/htahad.RData")

  pexptabph(exp = expx, nomfich = classeur, nomsheet = "popu", lg = TRUE)
